properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 4 at 5:26AM EST until January 5 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...

Suwanee Creek near Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County

Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton
Counties

Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Big Creek near Alpharetta.
* Until Sunday afternoon.
* At 445 AM Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet and falling.
* Minor flooding is occurring, and minor flooding is forecast to
continue.
* Flood stage is 7 feet.
* The creek will continue falling, dropping below flood stage
Sunday Afternoon.
* Between 8 and 9 feet, minor flooding continues in the woodlands
and fields along the creek from near Cumming in south Forsyth
County to Alpharetta and Roswell in north Fulton County. Portions
of The Big Creek Greenway will have minor flooding with 1 to 2
feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths will be
closed, especially upstream and downstream from the gage on
Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA
Campground off Preston Ridge Road will also be flooded.
